column6: Measures the overall scale of the business and total market capture.
Identifies the average contribution of each SKU to total sales.
Tracks the physical distribution and operational footprint of the brand.
Defines the brand's market positioning (Budget vs. Premium).
Tracks consumer shift toward health-conscious purchasing patterns.
Measures the actual quantity demand, independent of price fluctuations.
Used for operational planning in warehousing and transportation.
Pinpoints top revenue-driving product categories to inform inventory planning and expansion decisions.
Determines the share of revenue from premium-priced products, indicating brand positioning and customer spending capacity.
Tracks consumer preference toward health-conscious products and supports nutritional product strategy.
Indicates product variety offered by the business.
Indicates average shelf exposure across products.
Evaluates brand maturity and market stability by measuring the average operational lifespan of the retail network to distinguish between legacy trust and new market expansion.
